business.headline: Volkswagen sues Indian authorities over $1.4 billion tax notice: ReportThe tax dispute began in September 2024, when Indian authorities issued a $1.4 billion tax notice to Volkswagen's Skoda Auto Volkswagen India unit.

Explained: Why rupee fell past 87 against US dollar to a record lowThe Indian rupee (INR) dropped to an all-time low of Rs 87.1450 per dollar, down 0.6% from Friday. It may be noted that the rupee has fallen almost 4% since October 2024.
Sensex tanks 700 points: Why is the stock market falling today?Stock market crash: Sensex plunged over 700 points and Nifty lost nearly 300 points in early trade.

Rupee hits an all-time low to go past Rs 87 against US dollar. Here's why Rupee hit an all-time low, breaching 87 per US dollar for the first time. The sharp fall was mainly triggered by three executive orders signed by Trump over the weekend.

Markets in red: Sensex drops 500 points, rupee hits record lowShare Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 516.30 points to 76,989.66, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 230.90 points to 23,251.25 as of 9:25 AM.

Stock market today: Will Sensex, Nifty rally after Budget 2025? Stocks to buyShare Market Today: Market experts believe that while the budget had some positive aspects, certain key areas did not meet expectations.

Earning up to Rs 12 lakh? Here's how new marginal tax relief benefits youUnion Budget 2025: One of the key highlights of Budget 2025 was that individuals earning up to Rs 12 lakh will not have to pay any income tax under the new tax regime.

Rupee not falling against any currency other than US dollar: Nirmala SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rejected criticism of the rupee's decline, stating it remains stable against most currencies despite a stronger US dollar. She attributed volatility to global factors and highlighted India's strong macroeconomic fundamentals.

Gone bananas! Most Kerala tea-time snacks come under 18% GST From 'pazhampori' to 'ada' and 'undam pori,' beloved Malayali tea-time snacks find themselves caught in the bewildering GST maze. These humble delicacies come with an 18 per cent GST tag, all because they do not have the required 'classification' to be put elsewhere.

Harley-Davidson bikes to get cheaper as Centre cuts tariff amid Trump threatDonald Trump has consistently pushed for reducing trade barriers, especially on products that the US manufactures, and the high tariff on Harley-Davidson has been a point of contention in the past.
Increased TDS limit, exemption for NSS: Big relief for senior citizens Budget 2025 announced major tax reforms for senior citizens, reducing their tax burden and giving a boost to their savings.

Will boost savings, investment, consumption, growth: PM on BudgetPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Union Budget 2025, calling it a "force multiplier" that will boost savings, investment, consumption, and growth.
TDS reforms announced, limit for senior citizens doubledBudget 2025: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced an increase in the TDS threshold in the Union Budget 2025.

Everyone's praising you, Budget is very good: PM praises Nirmala SitharamanThe Prime Minister walked up to the bench where Nirmala Sitharaman was seated and expressed his gratitude for presenting her eighth and the Modi 3.0 government's first Budget today.

No tax payable up to Rs 12 lakh income: Budget bonanza for middle classFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that taxpayers with salaries up to Rs 12 lakh would not be required to pay tax in the new tax regime. Sitharaman also proposed changes in the slab structure of the new income tax regime.
New Income Tax Bill next week, will focus on easing taxpayer convenience: Finance MinisterFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to unveil new Income Tax Bill next week.
Boost for MSMEs, classification investment cap to be hiked 2.5 times The Indian government would strengthen the country's MSME sector.

Middle class hero with massive tax relief, Bihar big beneficiaryFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced big reforms focused on income tax relief for the middle class in addition to major reforms in agriculture, with Bihar in focus.

Budget for common man, says PM Modi at Cabinet meet: SourcesBudget 2025-2026 is likely to provide a much-needed boost to the middle class amid high inflation with the nation's GDP growth projected to slow down to a four-year low of 6.4 per cent.

Will stock market investors get tax relief from this budget?Capital gains tax and stock market investors: Experts anticipate that Budget 2025 should not announce new taxes, instead, provide tax rebates to boost the consumption levels and revive market sentiment.

entertainment.headline: Grammys 2025: Sabrina Carpenter beats Taylor Swift, wins Best Pop Vocal AlbumAt the 67th Annual Grammy Awards, Sabrina Carpenter won Best Pop Vocal Album, surpassing Taylor Swift.

Grammys 2025: Beyonce becomes first Black woman to win Album of the YearThe 67th Annual Grammy Awards celebrated music's finest, with Beyonce's Cowboy Carter clinching Album of the Year. This made her the first black woman to win this honour in the 21st century.

Video: Kanye West's wife Bianca Censori's nude outfit reveal at Grammys 2025Kanye West and his wife Bianca Censori turned heads at the 67th Grammys with their unexpected appearance. Bianca's almost nude look at the event left everyone shocked. The couple were reportedly escorted out of the Grammys. It is being speculated that Bianca's controversial dress could have been the reason for the couple's ouster from the awards show.

Can Kanye's wife Bianca Censori be arrested because of her 'naked' Grammys look?Kanye West and his wife Bianca Censori made headlines at the 67th Grammys with their unexpected appearance. Bianca's sheer dress, almost giving the illusion of nudity, led to speculation about potential legal issues.

Beyonce wins Album of the Year67th Annual Grammy Awards highlights: The Grammy Awards were held in Los Angeles on February 3 (IST). Singer Beyonce made history by bagging Album of the Year, making her the first Black woman to do so. The awards ceremony was hosted by TV personality and writer Trevor Noah.
Squid Game 2 actor Lee Joo-shil dies at 80Beloved South Korean actor Lee Joo-shil has died at 80 after a brief battle with stomach cancer. She was most recently seen in Squid Game 2.

Raghav Chadha jams with Mika Singh on Something Something at Delhi rallyAAP leader Raghav Chadha was seen jamming with singer Mika Singh during a political rally in Delhi. The duo performed a popular track amid the ongoing election campaign.

Netflix's The Sandman cancelled, to end with Season 2The production of The Sandman has been cancelled following sexual harassment allegations against creator Neil Gaiman. Despite this, Netflix will still release season two in 2025.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.
